net.glxn.qbe

Class QBEExample<T,E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.glxn.qbe.QBEExample<T,E>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the example class type
    E - the entity class type

    public class QBEExample<T,E>
extends Object
    This class is where the QBE magic happens. Once you have an instance of this class you can call the following:
    * list()
    * item()
    * getQuery()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.persistence.TypedQuery<E> getQuery()
      get the TypedQuery that has been generating based on the example and entity.
      E item()
      gets item using TypedQuery.getSingleResult()

      NB: any exception thrown from the underlying TypedQuery call will bubble through
      List<E> list()
      gets results by calling TypedQuery.getResultList() NB: any exception thrown from the underlying TypedQuery call will bubble through
      QBEExample<T,E> order(String orderBy, OrderType orderType)
      Defines the order of the result set
      QBEExample<T,E> usingJunctionType(JunctionType junctionType)
      overrides the JunctionType on this object instance then returns itself
      QBEExample<T,E> usingMatchType(MatchType matchType)
      overrides the MatchType on this object instance then returns itself

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Returns:

      • order

        public QBEExample<T,E> order(String orderBy,
                    OrderType orderType)
                      throws OrderCreationException
        Defines the order of the result set
        Parameters:
        orderBy - the property to order by, can be one of the following: Column annotated property on entity, XmlElement annotated property on example, or simply the field name on entity or example class
        orderType - signals the order to be ascending or descending
        Returns:
        the QBEExample object instance
        Throws:
        OrderCreationException - if the orderBy parameter can not be matched against any of the following paths as described in the parameter doc

      • getQuery

        public javax.persistence.TypedQuery<E> getQuery()
        get the TypedQuery that has been generating based on the example and entity.
        Returns:
        the typed query

      • list

        public List<E> list()
        gets results by calling TypedQuery.getResultList() NB: any exception thrown from the underlying TypedQuery call will bubble through
        Returns:
        list of results

      • item

        public E item()
        gets item using TypedQuery.getSingleResult()

        NB: any exception thrown from the underlying TypedQuery call will bubble through
        Returns:
        the single item matching the query
